skill.description: Create new Claude Code Skills with proper YAML frontmatter, progressive disclosure structure, and complete directory organization

skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation and template skill that generates markdown files. Contains no executable code, no file system access beyond its own directory, no network requests, and no external command execution capabilities. The skill only provides templates and documentation for creating Claude Code Skills.

content.value_statement: Creating Claude Code Skills from scratch requires consistent structure, YAML frontmatter, and proper documentation. This skill provides templates and generators to standardize skill creation across your team.
limitations: Does not execute or deploy skills automatically
Requires claude-flow CLI tool for running generated skills
Does not validate external dependencies or prerequisites

use_cases.title: Create new skills
use_cases.description: Generate properly structured skill templates with all required files and documentation

use_cases.title: Standardize skill format
use_cases.description: Ensure all team skills follow consistent naming, structure, and documentation patterns

use_cases.title: Build skill libraries
use_cases.description: Create reusable skill templates for different task categories and workflows

prompt_templates.title: Basic skill creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill named when-x-use-y-skill in the utilities category with 3 phases: design, build, test

prompt_templates.title: Complex skill template
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete skill with 5 phases, YAML frontmatter, memory patterns, and hooks integration for machine-learning category

prompt_templates.title: Convert workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this workflow specification into a proper skill template with SKILL.md, README.md, and PROCESS.md files

prompt_templates.title: Batch generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a batch of skill templates for common development tasks: code review, testing, documentation, and deployment

output_examples.input: Create a new skill called when-analyzing-code-use-code-auditor

best_practices: Use the when-[condition]-use-[skill-name] naming convention for consistency
Include 3-5 phases with clear objectives and validation criteria
Always add YAML frontmatter with proper metadata and dependencies
anti_patterns: Skipping YAML frontmatter - makes skills undiscoverable and untestable
Creating single-phase skills that handle too many responsibilities
Omitting documentation and usage examples from generated skills

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex through the claude-flow CLI tool for skill execution

faq.question: What is the maximum number of phases?
faq.answer: No hard limit, but 3-5 phases provide optimal structure and maintainability

faq.question: How do I integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Generated skills can be chained using cascade patterns or called programmatically via claude-flow skill-run

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only generates templates locally. No data is sent to external servers during template creation

faq.question: Why does validation fail?
faq.answer: Check YAML syntax, ensure all 4 required files exist, and verify phase structure follows the specification

faq.question: How does this compare to manual creation?
faq.answer: Automates consistent structure, reduces errors, and ensures all required metadata and documentation are included
